title: 2 Easy Ways to Remove Audio from an iPhone Video: Photos & iMovie

steps.title: Open Photos on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Photos on your iPhone. The Photos app has a rainbow flower-like icon on a white background.

steps.title: Tap the video you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the video you want to edit. You can find it in the Library tab or Albums tab.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . This button is in the top-right corner of the video. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the sound icon.
steps.content: Tap the sound icon. This is a yellow speaker in the top-left corner of the Edit menu. It will turn gray and have a line crossing through it after you tap it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . You’ve successfully removed the audio from the video! You can restore the audio by going back into the Edit menu and pressing the speaker icon again. If you’re sharing this video and it’s especially long, check out our guide on sending a long video from your iPhone.

steps.title: Open iMovie on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open iMovie on your iPhone. It has a white star on a purple background. [3] X Research source If you deleted the iMovie app, you can redownload it from the App Store if needed. iMovie is a great option if you want to replace the sound in your video with something else. For example, if you're making a cooking video and want to replace the audio with a voiceover!

steps.title: Tap Movie.
steps.content: Tap Movie . This will appear when you first open the app under “Start New Project.” [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the video you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the video you want to edit. This will appear in the “Moments” screen after pressing Movie . Tapping the video will select it.

steps.title: Tap Create Movie.
steps.content: Tap Create Movie . This is at the bottom of the video selection screen.

steps.title: Tap the video clip.
steps.content: Tap the video clip. This will select it, showing a yellow outline to indicate that it has been selected.

steps.title: Tap the Actions icon.
steps.content: Tap the Actions icon. This is the white button with a scissors icon in the bottom-left corner. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Detach.
steps.content: Tap Detach . This will detach the audio from the video clip. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the audio clip.
steps.content: Tap the audio clip. It's the blue bar under the video clip.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This will delete the sound from the iMovie project. You’re ready to insert a new audio clip or combine the video with another video. [7] X Research source If you don’t see Delete , tap the Actions button. You can also adjust the audio volume by tapping the speaker icon at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Save your video.
steps.content: Save your video. After removing the sound from the video, you'll want to save it so it's easy to share with others. To save your video: Tap Done to finish editing. [8] X Research source Tap the Share icon, which is a square with an up-pointing arrow. To save the video to your camera roll so you can access it in the Photos app, tap Save Video . If you want to change the resolution or video format, tap Options , and then select a resolution. When you're finished, tap Done . Tap Save Video .
